page.title: 02Visitors Guide To Notgrove
page.content: Superb views from the main A436 road greet the visitor entering this area from the West. Just behind a layby near West Field Farm, is the Notgrove Long Barrow open to the public. Taking the Notgrove road the visitor soon enters this charming and peaceful village, with its neat cottages well restored and surrounded by attractive gardens full of flowers and vegetables. No modern development mars the view of the mellow Cotswold stone buildings, between which are glimpsed grazing sheep and growing crops. The parish church of Saint Bartholomew has a small octagonal spire, and is of Norman origin, although it is said to stand on the site of a Roman burial ground. It has much to show the visitor, including a Needlework covering the wall behind the Altar.
